title: Mac OS in fullscreen stop the drop down menu showing the resizing icons (traffic lights)
content: On Mac OS is there a way to stop the drop down menu bar from appearing while in full screen whenever you move the mouse to the top of the screen? When I switch between tabs that action is often triggered which is distracting.
creator: cmroll75

content: firefox 110 is slow. I tried to go back to 109. I couldn't figure out how to get back to my old profile. How can I do that? Thanks!

title: after clean start with no/blank page gpu on one thread goes>95percent all time and slows ff
content: this situation starts about 2 weeks ago ... sometimes help to kill sick process and restart all firefox ... in windows task manager one of ff processes/threads consumes more than 20 percent cpu in ff task manager shows that gpu goes 95 percent i have reinstalled actual version 110.0 64bit updated nvidia driver (have 1660) tried disable/enable hw acceleration clear history, profiles ... dunno what to do next except using other browser my actual typing is 1-2 characters per second, so slowed the firefox is this mail takes almost 10 minutes to write ...
creator: rai.banzaii

title: Why the Google "G" in browser?
content: Why is the Google "G" in browser window when using Firefox?
creator: info8753

title: URL's scroll horizontally without stopping when Outlook "click here to view in web browser" is used
content: Outlook often puts up a message in the message window saying "Click here to view in browser." In recent weeks (not always) when I click the message I jump to Firefox and multiple repeats of the URL of the chosen message start rapidly streaming across the toolbar (right name?) below the menu bar on the Firefox window. I don't know how to tackle the problem. It takes stopping the browser with Task Manager to stop the behavior. Is it a Firefox issue, or a Windows 11 issue, or an Outlook issue? I don't expect an immediate answer, I just want to get an idea for how to get help on this issue. The Outlook email image seems entirely normal. Can you help point me in the right direction? Thank you, Greg Schultz
creator: Gresch

title: Firefox on Windows 10 using excessive CPU and is unresponsive since last update
content:
Firefox appeared to apply an update last night. Since then it has been using excessive CPU and doesn't fully initialize. I tried stopping and restarting, and eventually deleted the program completely and re-installed. Still no change and I can't initialize far enough to get the current version. However I downloaded the current installation file and re-installed from that.

Any ideas on how to fix this?

Other information: Windows 10 to the current fix level. Firefox was running fine 24 hours ago.
creator: gareth7

title: Clickable links failure
content:
Almost across the board, anytime I click a link, be it in email, or on a website, I get a page reading "Secure Connection Failed

An error occurred during a connection to www.skype.com. PR_END_OF_FILE_ERROR

Error code: PR_END_OF_FILE_ERROR 

   The page you are trying to view cannot be shown because the authenticity of the received data could not be verified.    Please contact the website owners to inform them of this problem."

Why?
creator: ansilatoms

title: website is not loading after redirection was added.
content:
Hi there, My website - lovecreatesfreedom.com was had a redirect created in Namecheap to go to a facebook group. Now the website is not loading at all. It works fine in Chrome and Edge but not firefox or brave.

I keep getting the below error message The connection has timed out

An error occurred during a connection to lovecreatesfreedom.com. 

   The site could be temporarily unavailable or too busy. Try again in a few moments.    If you are unable to load any pages, check your computerâ€™s network connection.    If your computer or network is protected by a firewall or proxy, make sure that Firefox is permitted to access the web.

Can anyone help me please. Namecheap said from their end it is fine.
creator: lovecreatesfreedom

title: Have been trying to overcome/identify issues using Ancestry.Com with Firefox
content:
I have been trying to identify ongoing problems using Firefox (78.15.0esr (64bit)) on a Mac (using OS10.11.6) wiht Ancestry.com.

Most of the system works fine , except for their internal mail system and graphics.

When I copied some of the text produced (i.e. graphics) into BBEdit, I was able to isolate and produce a graphics output, so I am stumped.

When I spent hours trying to interact with Ancestry, all they do is to send links to FAQ (the same one form different issues) indicating that their 'Tech Support' is less than basic. they of course indicate that Firefox is the issue, but i don't believe this is the case.

I have used another Mac computer to try to access with no luck (changed settings on Firefox e.g. extensions).

Looking for a way to problem solve etc to rule out issues.

BTW Ancestry recommends the use of Firefox as the browser of choice.

regards

Jim
creator: rynnejt

title: Keep pinned tabs
content:
Is there a way to keep pinned tabs on the current website? I would like to pin a few tabs that persist even if I use the URL bar to navigate away from it.

Let's say I have gmail as a pinned tab. Currently if I'm in gmail and I type in a different URL then gmail is no longer available, I'd like firefox to know that I want to keep gmail open and it would open the URL in a different tab. Is this a possibility or is there an extension that could help with this?
creator: marc.e.fleming

title: Firefox displaying connection reset errors, but Opera works fine
content:
Firefox has been working for years on this PC since I bought it.

Today when I try to access say, google.com, or any other URL in Firefox , the browser returns "The connection was reset" and fails to load the page or any other.

I installed Opera and it works fine ....

I can access any other internet resource from the PC, e.g FTP, Remote MySQL, I can ping domains e.g. google.com

In FF I Flushed entire cache - no change.

I have uninstalled FF, removed Mozilla in %Programdata%, %Appdata% and all registry entries then re-installed FF , but still getting "The connection was reset" ...

Switched off Kaspersky - no change

Windows 10 22H2 (19045.2604)
creator: upsalla
